faqs.question: How much does SimNet Home Internet cost per month?
faqs.answer: $99 per month flat rate with no taxes, fees, or hidden charges. Equipment is included at no additional cost. No credit check required and no long-term contract.

faqs.question: Is there really unlimited data with no throttling?
faqs.answer: Yes, truly unlimited. No data caps, no throttling after certain usage, and no overage fees. Stream, game, and work as much as you need without worry.

faqs.question: How fast is the internet speed?
faqs.answer: Speeds up to 100 Mbps depending on your location and cellular coverage. Most customers experience 25-75 Mbps, which is ideal for HD streaming, video calls, and working from home.

faqs.question: How long does installation take?
faqs.answer: Self-installation takes 15-30 minutes. We ship pre-configured equipment to your door. Simply plug in the router, connect the antenna, and you're online. Our support team is available if you need help.

faqs.question: Does it work in bad weather like rain or snow?
faqs.answer: Yes, cellular LTE service is weather-resistant and works in rain, snow, and storms. Unlike satellite internet (like Starlink) that degrades during weather events, our cellular-based service maintains connectivity.

faqs.question: How does this compare to Starlink?
faqs.answer: SimNet costs $99/month vs Starlink's $120-$540/month. Our equipment is included vs Starlink's $500+ dish purchase. We offer plug-and-play setup vs rooftop installation, and we work in any weather. You also get US-based phone support vs chatbot only.

faqs.question: Is SimNet better than Nomad Internet or Blazing Hog?
faqs.answer: Yes. SimNet is a fully authorized wireless provider with direct carrier relationships. Unlike gray-market resellers like Nomad Internet or Blazing Hog, we offer legal service guarantees with no risk of sudden termination. We provide legitimate, sustainable service.

faqs.question: Do I need a phone line or cable connection?
faqs.answer: No. SimNet uses cellular networks, so you don't need any existing phone line, cable, or fiber infrastructure. If you have cell phone coverage at your location, you can get our internet service.

faqs.question: What's the latency for video calls and gaming?
faqs.answer: 30-50ms latency, which is 10X better than satellite internet's 600ms+. This makes video calls smooth and responsive, and gaming playable without lag.

faqs.question: Can I use this for working from home?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. Many customers use SimNet for remote work, including Zoom meetings, VPN access, file uploads, and cloud applications. The low latency and reliable speeds make it ideal for professional work.

faqs.question: Is there a contract or cancellation fee?
faqs.answer: No long-term contract. Service is month-to-month. Cancel anytime with no penalties or fees. Perfect for seasonal homes or temporary needs.

faqs.question: How do I know if SimNet is available at my address?
faqs.answer: Contact us for a free coverage check. If you have cellular coverage at your location (check if your cell phone works there), you can likely get SimNet service.

faqs.question: What equipment do I get?
faqs.answer: You receive a pre-configured wireless router, external antenna, power supply, and all necessary cables. Everything is included in the $99/month price with no additional equipment charges.

faqs.question: Can multiple people use the internet at the same time?
faqs.answer: Yes. The connection supports multiple users and devices simultaneously. Families can stream on multiple TVs, work from home, and browse all at the same time.

faqs.question: What kind of support do you offer?
faqs.answer: US-based phone support with real technicians who understand rural connectivity challenges. Unlike satellite providers with chatbot-only support, you can speak to an actual person who can help troubleshoot.

faqs.question: What should I look for when choosing a rural internet provider?
faqs.answer: Look for three key things: authorization status (direct carrier partnerships ensure service stability), professional support (US-based technical help when you need it), and transparent terms (clear policies about data, speeds, and service guarantees). SimNet checks all these boxes - we're a fully authorized wireless provider with direct carrier relationships, offer professional US-based support, and are upfront about our service terms including fair usage policies. We're built for the long term with sustainable business relationships that provide consistent, reliable service.
faqs.keyword_focus: choosing rural internet provider, authorized wireless provider, reliable rural internet

faqs.question: Is cellular internet reliable enough for daily use?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. Modern 4G LTE and 5G cellular networks provide highly reliable connectivity. SimNet's authorized carrier partnerships ensure consistent service with professional-grade equipment and support. Our customers successfully run their entire digital lives on our service - remote work, video calls, streaming, online gaming, and smart home devices. With 30-50ms latency and speeds up to 100 Mbps, you get cable-like performance with the advantage of working anywhere you have cellular coverage. Plus, our support team is always available if you need help.
faqs.keyword_focus: is cellular internet reliable, lte internet for home, cellular internet daily use

faqs.question: Can I game on cellular internet, or is Starlink better for gaming?
faqs.answer: Cellular internet is actually better for gaming than Starlink. SimNet's 30-50ms latency is 10-12 times lower than Starlink's 600-800ms latency. For gaming, latency matters more than raw speed. Low latency means responsive controls and smooth gameplay. Most online games require less than 100ms latency for competitive play - SimNet easily meets this, while Starlink's high latency causes noticeable lag. If gaming is important to you, cellular beats satellite every time.
faqs.keyword_focus: cellular internet for gaming, gaming latency cellular vs starlink, best rural internet for gaming

faqs.question: Will my cellular internet be deprioritized during network congestion?
faqs.answer: SimNet uses plans that have priority over standard consumer mobile phone and tablet plans. While all internet providers have network management policies during extreme congestion, our service maintains priority status on the carrier networks. Most rural and underserved areas don't experience the tower congestion that affects dense urban areas, so customers typically see consistent performance. Our service is subject to fair usage policies like all providers, ensuring network quality for everyone while supporting typical household usage patterns.
faqs.keyword_focus: cellular internet deprioritization, data priority cellular, network priority home internet

faqs.question: What makes SimNet different from other rural internet providers?
faqs.answer: Three core differentiators: authorization, support, and stability. We're a fully authorized wireless provider with direct carrier partnerships, which means guaranteed service continuity and no risk of sudden terminations. You get professional US-based support from real technicians who can solve problems, not chatbots or overseas call centers. And we're transparent about our terms - what you see is what you get, with honest policies and sustainable business relationships. We've built SimNet to be here for the long haul, serving rural communities with reliable connectivity they can count on.
faqs.keyword_focus: simnet wireless benefits, authorized cellular provider, professional rural internet support

faqs.question: What happens if I use a lot of data each month?
faqs.answer: Our service is designed for heavy home internet use - streaming, gaming, working from home, and multiple users. Like all internet providers, we have fair usage policies to ensure quality service for all customers, but typical household usage falls well within normal parameters. The average household uses 300-600GB per month, and our service comfortably handles that level of use. We're upfront about our policies from the start, so you know exactly what to expect. No surprise slowdowns, no hidden thresholds - just honest, reliable service.
faqs.keyword_focus: high data usage cellular internet, fair usage policy, unlimited cellular internet home

faqs.question: How does SimNet compare to Starlink for streaming Netflix and YouTube?
faqs.answer: Both work for streaming, but SimNet has distinct advantages. SimNet maintains full speed in rain and snow while Starlink experiences 'rain fade' that causes buffering during storms. SimNet's lower latency (30-50ms vs 600ms+) makes browsing and app usage more responsive. Both handle 4K streaming fine during good conditions, but SimNet is more consistent through weather events. Plus at $99/month vs $120-$540 for Starlink's plans, SimNet costs significantly less for comparable streaming performance. You also get professional support and no $500+ equipment purchase.
faqs.keyword_focus: starlink vs cellular for streaming, netflix on cellular internet, streaming reliability rural

faqs.question: Can I use VPN with SimNet home internet?
faqs.answer: Yes, VPNs work perfectly with SimNet. Many remote workers use VPNs to access company networks, and our low latency (30-50ms) ensures responsive VPN performance. Unlike some satellite connections that struggle with VPN overhead, cellular internet handles encrypted traffic smoothly. If your employer requires VPN access, SimNet supports it with no special configuration needed. Just connect your VPN client like you would on any other internet connection.
faqs.keyword_focus: vpn on cellular internet, work from home vpn rural, cellular internet vpn compatible

faqs.question: What's the fastest rural internet option in 2025?
faqs.answer: It depends on your location. Fiber is fastest where available (though rare in rural areas). Starlink offers 50-200 Mbps but with high latency and weather sensitivity. SimNet offers 25-100 Mbps with low latency and weather resistance. For most rural users, SimNet provides the best balance of speed, reliability, and affordability. The key question isn't just 'what's fastest' but 'what's most reliable and usable.' A 100 Mbps connection that works in storms and delivers low-latency performance is more valuable than 200 Mbps that drops out when it rains or lags during video calls.
faqs.keyword_focus: fastest rural internet 2025, best rural internet provider, rural internet speed comparison

faqs.question: Will SimNet work in my specific rural location?
faqs.answer: If you have cellular phone service at your location (any carrier), you can very likely get SimNet internet. Contact us for a free coverage check. We'll verify signal strength and provide an honest assessment. If cellular coverage is too weak, we'll tell you upfront rather than selling you service that won't work well. We can also recommend antenna placement or signal enhancement solutions if needed. Our goal is to provide service that actually works for you, not just make a sale. That's the SimNet difference - honest assessments and professional support.
faqs.keyword_focus: simnet coverage check, will cellular internet work at my address, rural internet availability check

key_features: Multi-carrier diversity across all major US networks

faqs.question: What is internet failover?
faqs.answer: Internet failover is an automatic backup system that switches to a secondary internet connection when your primary connection fails. This ensures your business stays online with minimal disruption (typically under 30 seconds of downtime).

faqs.question: How fast does the failover switch happen?
faqs.answer: Sub-30 second automatic switching. When our monitoring system detects your primary connection has failed, it immediately routes traffic to the backup connection, minimizing business disruption.

faqs.question: What is multi-carrier diversity and why does it matter?
faqs.answer: Multi-carrier diversity means your primary and backup connections use different cellular carriers (AT&T, Verizon, T-Mobile). This prevents a single carrier outage from affecting both connections. True redundancy requires carrier diversity, not just multiple connections from the same provider.

faqs.question: What uptime SLA do you offer?
faqs.answer: 99.99% uptime SLA, which translates to less than 53 minutes of downtime per year. This is backed by our multi-carrier approach and 24/7 monitoring.

faqs.question: How much does failover service cost?
faqs.answer: Pricing is customized based on your bandwidth requirements, SLA needs, and number of locations. Contact us for a quote tailored to your specific business requirements.

faqs.question: Can you monitor my existing internet connection?
faqs.answer: Yes. We can monitor your existing fiber, cable, or DSL connection and provide cellular failover as backup. Our system continuously checks link health and automatically switches when needed.

faqs.question: Do I need special equipment?
faqs.answer: We provide enterprise-grade failover routers that handle automatic switching, load balancing, and monitoring. The equipment integrates with your existing network infrastructure.

faqs.question: Will my VoIP phones work during failover?
faqs.answer: Yes. The failover happens transparently, so VoIP calls, video conferences, and other real-time applications continue working on the backup connection with minimal interruption.

faqs.question: How do you handle ATM connectivity?
faqs.answer: We specialize in ATM failover with proven experience in financial services. Our solutions meet banking security requirements and provide the reliability financial institutions demand.

faqs.question: Can you provide failover for multiple locations?
faqs.answer: Yes. We manage failover solutions for businesses with multiple branches, retail stores, or distributed facilities. Centralized monitoring gives you visibility across all locations.

faqs.question: What happens if both connections fail?
faqs.answer: While extremely rare with true multi-carrier diversity, we provide immediate alerts and 24/7 support to restore service. Our monitoring system notifies both you and our technical team instantly.

faqs.question: Is this just for backup or can I use both connections?
faqs.answer: You can configure it either way. Use the backup connection only when primary fails, or use load balancing to distribute traffic across both connections for increased total bandwidth.

faqs.question: How long does installation take?
faqs.answer: Typically 3-5 business days from order to installation. For urgent needs, we can often expedite to 24-48 hours. Installation is professional and minimally disruptive.

faqs.question: Do you provide 24/7 support?
faqs.answer: Yes. Our network operations center monitors your connections 24/7/365, and US-based technical support is available around the clock for critical issues.

faqs.question: Can I test the failover before going live?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. We conduct failover testing during installation and can schedule periodic tests to verify the system works as expected. You can also initiate tests anytime.

faqs.question: What industries do you serve?
faqs.answer: We serve financial services, healthcare, retail, hospitality, manufacturing, call centers, and any business where internet downtime directly impacts operations or revenue.

faqs.question: How is this different from just having a backup modem?
faqs.answer: Manual backup modems require someone to physically switch connections and reconfigure systems. Our automatic failover happens in seconds without human intervention, preventing extended downtime and lost revenue.

faqs.question: Can you integrate with our existing SD-WAN?
faqs.answer: Yes. Our failover solutions integrate with major SD-WAN platforms and can serve as transport options within your existing SD-WAN architecture.

faqs.question: What monitoring and reporting do you provide?
faqs.answer: Real-time dashboard showing connection status, bandwidth usage, failover events, and uptime statistics. Automated alerts via email/SMS when issues occur.

faqs.question: Is there a contract?
faqs.answer: Typically yes for enterprise failover solutions, as the service includes managed equipment, SLA guarantees, and 24/7 monitoring. Contract terms are flexible based on your needs.

faqs.question: What's your experience with mission-critical applications?
faqs.answer: We've provided failover solutions for financial institutions, healthcare facilities, and operations where downtime costs thousands per minute. Our track record includes 99.99%+ uptime for demanding environments.

faqs.question: Can this work in rural areas?
faqs.answer: Yes. In fact, rural areas benefit most from failover since primary internet options are often less reliable. Our multi-carrier approach ensures backup coverage even in underserved markets.

faqs.question: What is a Distributed Antenna System (DAS)?
faqs.answer: A DAS is a network of antennas distributed throughout a building or area to provide consistent cellular coverage. It captures signal from outside and distributes it indoors, eliminating dead zones and improving call quality.

faqs.question: Why do I need DAS in my building?
faqs.answer: Modern buildings with thick walls, metal structures, or underground areas often block cellular signals. DAS ensures employees, customers, and emergency services can use cell phones and cellular devices throughout your facility.

faqs.question: How much does DAS installation cost?
faqs.answer: Costs vary significantly based on building size, layout, coverage requirements, and carrier needs. A typical installation ranges from $50,000 to $500,000+. We provide detailed quotes after a site survey.

faqs.question: What's the difference between DAS and cell signal boosters?
faqs.answer: Signal boosters amplify existing signal for small areas (1,000-5,000 sq ft). DAS is an engineered solution for large facilities (50,000+ sq ft) providing carrier-grade coverage throughout complex buildings.

faqs.question: Can DAS support all cellular carriers?
faqs.answer: Yes. Neutral-host DAS systems support all major carriers (AT&T, Verizon, T-Mobile, US Cellular) simultaneously, ensuring all employees and visitors have coverage regardless of their carrier.

faqs.question: How long does DAS installation take?
faqs.answer: Installation timelines range from 4-12 weeks depending on building size, complexity, and carrier coordination requirements. We provide detailed project schedules during planning.

faqs.question: What is CBRS and how does it relate to DAS?
faqs.answer: CBRS (Citizens Broadband Radio Service) is shared spectrum that allows private LTE/5G networks. It can be integrated with DAS for private cellular coverage without relying solely on public carrier networks.

faqs.question: Do I need carrier approval for DAS?
faqs.answer: Yes, for carrier-based DAS. We handle all carrier coordination, approvals, and ongoing relationships. Our established carrier partnerships streamline the approval process.

faqs.question: Will DAS work in underground parking garages?
faqs.answer: Yes. Underground areas are ideal candidates for DAS as they typically have zero cellular coverage. We design systems specifically for parking structures, basements, and tunnels.

faqs.question: What maintenance does DAS require?
faqs.answer: Minimal ongoing maintenance. We provide monitoring, annual inspections, and support for any issues. Most DAS systems operate reliably for 10+ years with proper maintenance.

faqs.question: Can DAS support emergency responder communications?
faqs.answer: Yes. Many jurisdictions require in-building emergency communication systems. DAS can be designed to meet public safety requirements and codes.

faqs.question: What's the difference between active and passive DAS?
faqs.answer: Passive DAS uses coaxial cable to distribute signal (lower cost, suitable for smaller areas). Active DAS uses fiber optic cable (higher capacity, better for large facilities). We design the right solution for your needs.

faqs.question: Can you add DAS to an existing building?
faqs.answer: Yes. We specialize in retrofitting DAS into existing buildings with minimal disruption. Our designs work around occupied spaces and business operations.

faqs.question: What's involved in a site survey?
faqs.answer: We measure existing signal strength, identify coverage gaps, assess building construction, plan antenna placement, and design the optimal system. Site surveys typically take 1-2 days depending on facility size.

core_services.target_market: Small to enterprise businesses in underserved areas
key_features: QoS for VoIP and critical applications
use_cases: Primary business internet where fiber unavailable

faqs.question: How fast is wireless business internet?
faqs.answer: Speeds range from 25-100 Mbps depending on location and plan. Most businesses get 50-75 Mbps, which supports video conferencing, VoIP, cloud applications, and multiple users.

faqs.question: Can I get a static IP address?
faqs.answer: Yes. Static IP addresses are available for businesses requiring remote access, VPN, security cameras, or server hosting. Static IPs are included with business plans.

faqs.question: How much does business internet cost?
faqs.answer: Pricing varies by speed tier and location. Plans typically range from $150-$500/month depending on bandwidth requirements and service level agreements. Contact us for a customized quote.

faqs.question: Is there a business-grade SLA?
faqs.answer: Yes. Business plans include service level agreements with uptime guarantees, priority support, and defined response times. SLA terms vary by plan level.

faqs.question: How long does installation take?
faqs.answer: Professional installation typically takes 3-5 business days from order. For urgent needs, we can often expedite to 24-48 hours. Installation includes equipment setup, testing, and training.

faqs.question: Can this handle VoIP phone systems?
faqs.answer: Yes. Our business internet includes Quality of Service (QoS) settings that prioritize voice traffic, ensuring clear call quality. Many businesses successfully run VoIP systems on our connections.

faqs.question: What if fiber becomes available later?
faqs.answer: No long-term contract required. If fiber becomes available, you can cancel without penalties. Many customers use us as a bridge solution until fiber arrives.

faqs.question: Can you provide internet for multiple locations?
faqs.answer: Yes. We manage connectivity for businesses with multiple branches, retail stores, or distributed offices. Multi-location discounts available.

faqs.question: Is upload speed the same as download speed?
faqs.answer: Connection speeds are generally symmetrical or near-symmetrical (similar upload and download speeds), which is ideal for businesses uploading files, backing up to cloud, or hosting services.

faqs.question: What support do business customers receive?
faqs.answer: Priority technical support with shorter response times, dedicated account management, and escalation procedures. Business customers get faster issue resolution than residential service.

key_features: Multi-carrier redundancy across all major US networks
Scalable data plans from 1MB to unlimited

faqs.question: What is IoT cellular connectivity?
faqs.answer: IoT cellular connectivity provides internet access for devices like sensors, trackers, and machines using cellular networks. It enables remote monitoring, data collection, and control of devices anywhere with cellular coverage.

faqs.question: How much data do IoT devices typically use?
faqs.answer: Usage varies widely. Simple sensors might use 1-10MB per month, GPS trackers 50-500MB, while video-enabled devices can use several GB. We offer scalable plans to match your specific device needs.

faqs.question: What is multi-carrier redundancy for IoT?
faqs.answer: Our SIM cards automatically connect to the strongest available carrier (AT&T, Verizon, T-Mobile) at any location. If one carrier has poor coverage or an outage, devices automatically switch to another carrier, ensuring continuous connectivity.

faqs.question: How much do IoT data plans cost?
faqs.answer: Plans start as low as $2-5 per device per month for low-data devices, scaling up based on data usage. Volume discounts available for deployments of 100+ devices. Contact us for customized pricing.

faqs.question: Can I manage all my devices from one platform?
faqs.answer: Yes. Our device management portal provides real-time visibility into all your IoT devices, including data usage, connectivity status, location (if GPS-enabled), and the ability to activate/deactivate SIMs.

faqs.question: What happens if a device exceeds its data limit?
faqs.answer: You choose the behavior: either the device stops data transmission (preventing overages), or it continues with overage charges. We provide usage alerts to help you monitor and avoid unexpected costs.

faqs.question: Do you provide SIM cards or do I need to supply them?
faqs.answer: We provide the SIM cards pre-configured with your data plan and multi-carrier access. Simply insert them into your devices and they're ready to connect.

faqs.question: Can I use this for ATM connectivity?
faqs.answer: Yes. We specialize in ATM and payment terminal connectivity with proven reliability in financial services. Our solutions meet security requirements and provide the uptime banks demand.

faqs.question: Is there an API for device management?
faqs.answer: Yes. Our API allows automated provisioning, monitoring, and management of IoT devices at scale. Ideal for integrating with your existing systems and workflows.

faqs.question: What coverage areas do you support?
faqs.answer: Nationwide coverage across all 50 US states through partnerships with all major carriers. Multi-carrier approach ensures connectivity even in rural or challenging areas where single carriers have gaps.

core_services.target_market: Businesses affected by copper network decommissioning
key_features: Drop-in replacement for copper POTS lines
Supports fax, alarms, elevators, and legacy equipment
FCC compliant for elevator and life safety
Works with existing equipment - no replacements needed

faqs.question: What is POTS replacement?
faqs.answer: POTS (Plain Old Telephone Service) replacement is a cellular-based solution that emulates traditional copper phone lines. As carriers decommission copper networks, our solution provides analog connectivity for elevators, alarms, fax machines, and other legacy equipment.

faqs.question: Why are carriers shutting down POTS lines?
faqs.answer: Traditional copper phone networks are expensive to maintain and being replaced by modern digital infrastructure. Carriers like AT&T and Verizon are systematically decommissioning copper networks, forcing businesses to find alternatives.

faqs.question: Will my elevator phone work with POTS replacement?
faqs.answer: Yes. Our solution is FCC Part 68 certified and designed specifically for elevator emergency phones. We meet all life safety requirements and have extensive experience with elevator applications.

faqs.question: Can I still use my fax machine?
faqs.answer: Yes. Our POTS replacement supports fax transmission. Many businesses successfully operate fax machines over our cellular-based analog connections.

faqs.question: How much does POTS replacement cost?
faqs.answer: Pricing is typically $40-80 per line per month depending on features and volume. This is competitive with traditional POTS line costs ($80-150/month) while providing better reliability and modern features.

faqs.question: What happens during a power outage?
faqs.answer: Our POTS replacement devices include battery backup (typically 4-8 hours) to maintain service during power failures. This ensures elevator phones and life safety systems remain operational during emergencies.

faqs.question: Do I need to replace my existing equipment?
faqs.answer: No. Our solution is a drop-in replacement that works with existing analog equipment. No need to replace elevators, alarm panels, fax machines, or other devices - they work exactly as before.

faqs.question: Is this compliant with elevator codes and regulations?
faqs.answer: Yes. Our solution meets FCC Part 68 requirements and is approved for elevator emergency communication. We have successful installations in hundreds of elevators nationwide.

faqs.question: How reliable is cellular POTS compared to copper?
faqs.answer: Modern cellular networks are often more reliable than aging copper infrastructure. Our carrier-grade cellular connectivity provides 99.9%+ uptime, typically exceeding copper line reliability.

faqs.question: Can this work for my fire alarm system?
faqs.answer: Yes. Our POTS replacement supports fire alarm monitoring and other security system applications. We work with major alarm monitoring companies and meet industry standards.

use_cases: Remote work locations beyond cellular coverage

faqs.question: What is managed Starlink service?
faqs.answer: Managed Starlink turns the consumer Starlink product into an enterprise-grade solution. We provide professional installation, US-based technical support, network monitoring, and integration with your existing infrastructure - everything Starlink doesn't offer directly.

faqs.question: Why do I need managed service instead of just buying Starlink?
faqs.answer: Starlink provides only chatbot support and expects customers to self-install and self-troubleshoot. For businesses, that's unacceptable. We provide human support, professional installation, proactive monitoring, and expertise in integrating satellite internet with business networks.

faqs.question: How much does managed Starlink service cost?
faqs.answer: Pricing includes the Starlink subscription ($120-$500/month depending on plan) plus our management fee ($100-300/month) based on service level. We handle billing, monitoring, and all coordination with Starlink.

faqs.question: Do you provide installation?
faqs.answer: Yes. We conduct site surveys to determine optimal dish placement, professionally install and mount the equipment, optimize pointing, integrate with your network, and verify performance before handoff.

faqs.question: What kind of support do you offer?
faqs.answer: US-based technical support via phone and email. Real technicians who understand satellite internet, rural connectivity, and business networking. We coordinate with Starlink on your behalf for any service issues.

faqs.question: Can you manage Starlink at multiple locations?
faqs.answer: Yes. We provide centralized management for businesses with multiple Starlink connections across different sites, giving you single-pane visibility and unified support.

faqs.question: Will Starlink work in bad weather?
faqs.answer: Starlink can experience degraded performance during heavy rain or snow (called rain fade). While better than older satellite internet, it's not as weather-resistant as cellular connections. We help optimize placement and provide realistic expectations.

faqs.question: Can you integrate Starlink with our existing network?
faqs.answer: Yes. We integrate Starlink as a WAN connection in your network, configure it to work with firewalls and SD-WAN systems, set up VLANs, and ensure proper security and routing.

faqs.question: Is Starlink good for failover/backup internet?
faqs.answer: Yes. Starlink works well as failover since it's a completely independent connection (satellite vs terrestrial). We configure automatic failover and monitor both connections.

faqs.question: What happens if the Starlink equipment fails?
faqs.answer: We coordinate replacement with Starlink, manage the RMA process, and ensure minimal downtime. With our service, you have someone to call instead of dealing with chatbot support.

core_services.target_market: All potential customers - businesses and residential
key_messaging: Specializing in underserved and rural markets
